TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit Adorner extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Manages a collection of user-interface related objects. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Adorner> can be enabled and disabled. Only enabled <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Adorner> objects will receive hit test and paint messages from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService>. An <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Adorner> can be viewed as a proxy between user-interface related elements, which consist of all <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Glyph> objects, and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService>.
For more information, see [Behavior Service Overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/7c60cc41-4324-46b5-b444-b39eda7cb33f).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Adorner> class interacts with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Glyph> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService> classes. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService> class.
:::code language="cpp" source="~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService/cpp/Form1.cpp" id="Snippet3"::: :::code language="csharp" source="~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService/CS/Form1.cs" id="Snippet3"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService/VB/Form1.vb" id="Snippet3":::

Docs.related: How to: Extend the Appearance and Behavior of Controls in Design Mode

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Adorner.%23ctor%2A> constructor creates a new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.GlyphCollection> and is enabled, by default.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Adorner> class. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService> class.
:::code language="cpp" source="~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService/cpp/Form1.cpp" id="Snippet3"::: :::code language="csharp" source="~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService/CS/Form1.cs" id="Snippet3"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService/VB/Form1.vb" id="Snippet3":::

remarks.format: ## Remarks When an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Adorner> is added to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorServiceAdornerCollection> of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService>, the collection sets this property so that the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Adorner> can call back to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the is enabled.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Adorner.Enabled%2A> property is `true`, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.BehaviorService> class will send `HitTest` and `Paint` messages to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Adorner>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to enable and disable an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.Behavior.Adorner>. For a full code listing, see [How to: Extend the Appearance and Behavior of Controls in Design Mode](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/visualstudio/visual-studio-2013/ms171820(v=vs.120)).
